required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of Carbidopa-levodopa in Patients With Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of L-DOPA Safety and Tolerability in Patients With AMD, and Proof of Concept That L-DOPA Improves Surrogate Biomarkers in Patients With Moderate to Advanced AMD

lead_sponsor.agency: Snyder, Robert W., M.D., Ph.D., P.C.

clinical_study.source: Snyder, Robert W., M.D., Ph.D., P.C.

brief_summary.textblock:
From 3 large patient databases, patients diagnosed with AMD who have never taken levodopa(L-DOPA) containing medications have a mean age of diagnosis at 71 years. Patients who have been treated with L-DOPA containing medications have a mean age of diagnosis of AMD at 79 years.
L-DOPA binds to GPR143 in the retinal pigment epithelium, and releases PEDF, which protects the retina and downregulates VEGF, which is the cause of neovascularization.
The Investigators will evaluate the safety and tolerability of carbidopa-levodopa in patients with AMD, and measure the effects on surrogate functional biomarkers of AMD.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Decided to do studies in patients with AMD

primary_outcome.description: Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) will be assessed at each visit. These will be classified as mild, moderate or severe and by body organ system. All AEs will be specifically reassessed at each subsequent visit. Serious AEs will be reported to the institutional Review Board(IRB). All AEs will be aggregated by treatment arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: After refraction to ascertain that the participant has the optimum correction for refractive error, standard visual acuity testing will be performed with an ETDRS chart. Results will be ascertained at 45 +/-5 and 90 +/- 10 days, due to different dosing during the first and second 45 day periods. Results will be aggregated by treatment arm and treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Low Light Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: Using lenses for optimum correction for refractive error, Standard visual acuity testing will be performed using an ETDRS chart under standardized low light conditions. Results will be ascertained at 45 +/- 5 and 90 +/- 10 days, due to different dosing during the first and second 45 day periods. Results will be aggregated by treatment arm and treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Dark Adaptation
secondary_outcome.description: Using an AdaptDX machine, using standardized intensity and duration of bright light, measurement of the time after bright light exposure required to adapt to dim light will be measured using rod intercept as the measurement. Results will be ascertained at 45 +/- 5 and 90 +/- 10 days, due to different dosing during the first and second 45 day periods. Results will be aggregated by treatment arm and treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Low Luminance Questionnaire Scores
secondary_outcome.description: This will be measured using a standard questionaire evaluating ability to function in low light conditions. Results will be tabulated by all correct answers and by number of correct answers on each subscale. Results will be ascertained at 45 +/- 5 and 90 +/- 10 days, due to different dosing during the first and second 45 day periods. Results will be aggregated by treatment arm and treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Optical Coherence Tomography
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating retinal structure, including drusen and reticular pseudodrusen using a standard scanning laser device. Results will be ascertained at 45 +/- 5 and 90 +/- 10 days, due to different dosing during the first and second 45 day periods. Results will be aggregated by treatment arm and treatment period.

arm_group.description: Treatment with carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg tablets dosed once daily at bedtime for 45 +/- 5 days followed by carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg tablets dosed 3 times daily for 45 +/- 5 days.

Treatment with placebo for carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg in identical tablets dosed once daily at bedtime for 45 +/- 5 days followed by placebo for carbidopa-levodopa 25-100 mg tablets dosed 3 times daily for 45 +/- 5 days.
